description.narrative: Targeted communities have the capacity to define and adhere to social norms favourable to pre-schooling and keeping children and adolescents in school, particularly girls and children living with disabilities., which contributes to Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Learning Outcomes, Operations Support To Programme Delivery. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, girls and boys of school age (4â€“19 years), particularly the most disadvantaged, have access to quality education and training and acquire basic skills.
